rooms.description: The entrance hall leads into a spacious living room with natural light, adhering to Vastu principles by facing east for positivity. A centrally located large window allows for ample sunlight and ventilation.
Adjacent to the living room, this open dining area offers a communal space for family meals. Designed with south-east orientation as per Vastu norms.
A modern kitchen equipped with ample storage and an adjoining pantry, oriented in the north to align with Vastu for auspicious energy and efficiency.
A modest living space for domestic help ensuring privacy and comfort, placed in the southwest corner to maintain a balance between service areas and family quarters.
Provides additional lodging with an attached bathroom. Designed near the main entrance for easy access, following Vastu's guidelines on guest room positioning.

openings.description: Large entryway ensuring ease of access and ample natural light.
Expansive window to enhance brightness in the living area.

external_features.description: Spacious balcony ensuring privacy and natural light, integrated with the master bedroom on upper floor.
Providing a view and outdoor space, aligned with Vastu for relaxation.

garden.description: A large garden area in the south-west corner ensuring ample greenery and privacy, adhering to local norms and promoting sustainability.

notes: The design integrates Chettinad style with modern amenities while respecting Vastu principles.
The plan is optimized for a family of four across two floors.
Servants' quarters are designed to provide comfort yet remain distinct from the main living areas.
Care has been taken to ensure ample natural light, ventilation, and spatial harmony in accordance with local building norms.
